ygData.subject: Re: Archery
ygData.msgSnippet: Paladin? You insult me! :) I am a shadow knight, of course. None of that goody-two-shoes crap here. :) Yes, due to the unbalancing nature of this item, I
ygData.messageBody:
Paladin? You insult me! :) I am a shadow knight, of course. None of that
goody-two-shoes crap here. :)

Yes, due to the unbalancing nature of this item, I believe it has to be
classified as a bug.

<<scuttles back to work>>

Jeremy

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Steven E. Phipps [mailto:phipps@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 9:53 AM
> To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [shadowknight] Archery
>
>
> From: "Steven E. Phipps" <phipps@...>
>
> perhaps thats why you have dubbed it a bug.
> You a paladin or a shadowknight?
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Jeremy Pollack <jpollack@...>
> To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 12:11 AM
> Subject: Re: [shadowknight] Archery
>
>
> > From: "Jeremy Pollack" <jpollack@...>
> >
> > I did not declare that anything was a bug exploit, I merely pointed out
> that
> > these daggers are a pathetically easy way of raising your Archery skill.
> Due
> > to Verant's EXCELLENT history of balancing this game, I find it
> extremely
> > difficult to believe that they would put a component in the world that
> would
> > allow you to raise your archery skill 5 points in 5 minutes
> when normally
> > archery takes an extraordinary amount of time to raise unless you use it
> > constantly. Yes, I did raise my own archery skill 5 points in 5 minutes
> (it
> > was already at 72) while testing it to see if it worked. The ability to
> > raise any skill, especially a combat one, that much in such a
> short amount
> > of time must be considered a bug or something that Verant does not
> realize.
> > If the daggers/pine needles were throwing weapons that went in
> the ranged
> > weapon slot and used up one each time, that would make it a little bit
> > better, but they are not, so for 8cp or something silly like
> that you get
> > this item to raise your skill to its max with one nights work
> or less. As
> > for waiting to hear back from someone of authority, I agree,
> that is why I
> > and all my compatriots have /bug'd this item. Your statement about them
> > using the archery skill due to the aim factor is just as much conjecture
> as
> > my statement, however. And by the way, the fact that they have such
> pathetic
> > damage makes them the reason that they are that much more powerful at
> > raising your archery skill.
> >
> > Anyways, I just hope that Verant fixes this major game-balance problem
> soon
> > before everyone and their momma is a master archer. :) I worked long and
> > hard to become as good at Archery as I am, and it seems silly
> that someone
> > can pick one of these items up and in a few hours of practice become a
> > master archer.
> >
> > Sincerely,
> > Jeremy Pollack, Shadow Knight, Solusek Ro
> >
> > > From: Leif Smart <leifsmart@...>
> > >
> > > It's hard;y a bug exploits. they use the arhcrey skill due to the
> > > aim factor.
> > > And the fact that they have such a pathetic damage. somthing like
> > > 1, tends to
> > > suggest this. I would suggest to wait to hear back from some one
> > > in authority
> > > before declaring something to be a bug exploit.
> > >
> > > Inos
> > > Veeshan
> > >
> > >
> > > Jeremy Pollack wrote:
> > >
> > > > From: "Jeremy Pollack" <jpollack@...>
> > > >
> > > > The tiny daggers and pine needles are *extremely likley*
> bugged melee
> > > > weapons. I have seen them and tested them just enough to make
> > > sure they are
> > > > actually bugged, and then I have /bug'd them and continued on
> > > my way. They
> > > > are melee weapons and help in the melee slot, there is
> > > absolutely no reason
> > > > they should help out your archery skill. It would be very cheap
> > > and possibly
> > > > an exploit to use these.
> > > >
> > > > > From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > "Then grab
> > > > > one of those needle thingy's which are like daggers but use
> > > the archery
> > > > > skill."
> > > > >
> > > > > UMMM.. what needle thingys might those be?
> > > > > And do you know where to get them in freeport?
> > > >
> > >
